00040 /* dco_required set to 1 will cause the CPU not to go into
00041    sleep modes where the DCO clock stopped */
00042 int msp430_dco_required;
00043 
00044 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00045 #if defined(__MSP430__) && defined(__GNUC__) && MSP430_MEMCPY_WORKAROUND
00046 void *
00047 w_memcpy(void *out, const void *in, size_t n)
00048 {
00049   uint8_t *src, *dest;
00050   src = (uint8_t *) in;
00051   dest = (uint8_t *) out;
00052   while(n-- > 0) {
00053     *dest++ = *src++;
00054   }
00055   return out;
00056 }
00057 #endif /* __GNUC__ &&  __MSP430__ && MSP430_MEMCPY_WORKAROUND */
00058 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00059 #if defined(__MSP430__) && defined(__GNUC__) && MSP430_MEMCPY_WORKAROUND
00060 void *
00061 w_memset(void *out, int value, size_t n)
00062 {
00063   uint8_t *dest;
00064   dest = (uint8_t *) out;
00065   while(n-- > 0) {
00066     *dest++ = value & 0xff;
00067   }
00068   return out;
00069 }
00070 #endif /* __GNUC__ &&  __MSP430__ && MSP430_MEMCPY_WORKAROUND */
00071 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00072 void
00073 msp430_init_dco(void)
00074 {
00075     /* This code taken from the FU Berlin sources and reformatted. */
00076 #define DELTA    ((MSP430_CPU_SPEED) / (32768 / 8))
00077 
00078   unsigned int compare, oldcapture = 0;
00079   unsigned int i;
00080 
00081 
00082   BCSCTL1 = 0xa4; /* ACLK is devided by 4. RSEL=6 no division for MCLK
00083                      and SSMCLK. XT2 is off. */
00084 
00085   BCSCTL2 = 0x00; /* Init FLL to desired frequency using the 32762Hz
00086                      crystal DCO frquenzy = 2,4576 MHz  */
00087 
00088   BCSCTL1 |= DIVA1 + DIVA0;             /* ACLK = LFXT1CLK/8 */
00089   for(i = 0xffff; i > 0; i--) {         /* Delay for XTAL to settle */
00090     asm("nop");
00091   }
00092 
00093   CCTL2 = CCIS0 + CM0 + CAP;            // Define CCR2, CAP, ACLK
00094   TACTL = TASSEL1 + TACLR + MC1;        // SMCLK, continous mode
00095 
00096 
00097   while(1) {
00098 
00099     while((CCTL2 & CCIFG) != CCIFG);    /* Wait until capture occured! */
00100     CCTL2 &= ~CCIFG;                    /* Capture occured, clear flag */
00101     compare = CCR2;                     /* Get current captured SMCLK */
00102     compare = compare - oldcapture;     /* SMCLK difference */
00103     oldcapture = CCR2;                  /* Save current captured SMCLK */
00104 
00105     if(DELTA == compare) {
00106       break;                            /* if equal, leave "while(1)" */
00107     } else if(DELTA < compare) {        /* DCO is too fast, slow it down */
00108       DCOCTL--;
00109       if(DCOCTL == 0xFF) {              /* Did DCO role under? */
00110         BCSCTL1--;
00111       }
00112     } else {                            /* -> Select next lower RSEL */
00113       DCOCTL++;
00114       if(DCOCTL == 0x00) {              /* Did DCO role over? */
00115         BCSCTL1++;
00116       }
00117                                         /* -> Select next higher RSEL  */
00118     }
00119   }
00120 
00121   CCTL2 = 0;                            /* Stop CCR2 function */
00122   TACTL = 0;                            /* Stop Timer_A */
00123 
00124   BCSCTL1 &= ~(DIVA1 + DIVA0);          /* remove /8 divisor from ACLK again */
00125 }
00126 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/

00128 static void
00129 init_ports(void)
00130 {
00131   /* Turn everything off, device drivers enable what is needed. */
00132   /* All configured for digital I/O */
00133 #ifdef P1SEL
00134   P1SEL = 0;
00135 #endif
00136 #ifdef P2SEL
00137   P2SEL = 0;
00138 #endif
00139 #ifdef P3SEL
00140   P3SEL = 0;
00141 #endif
00142 #ifdef P4SEL
00143   P4SEL = 0;
00144 #endif
00145 #ifdef P5SEL
00146   P5SEL = 0;
00147 #endif
00148 #ifdef P6SEL
00149   P6SEL = 0;
00150 #endif
00151 
00152   /* All available inputs */
00153 #ifdef P1DIR
00154   P1DIR = 0;
00155   P1OUT = 0;
00156 #endif
00157 #ifdef P2DIR
00158   P2DIR = 0;
00159   P2OUT = 0;
00160 #endif
00161 #ifdef P3DIR
00162   P3DIR = 0;
00163   P3OUT = 0;
00164 #endif
00165 #ifdef P4DIR
00166   P4DIR = 0;
00167   P4OUT = 0;
00168 #endif
00169 
00170 #ifdef P5DIR
00171   P5DIR = 0;
00172   P5OUT = 0;
00173 #endif
00174 
00175 #ifdef P6DIR
00176   P6DIR = 0;
00177   P6OUT = 0;
00178 #endif
00179 
00180   P1IE = 0;
00181   P2IE = 0;
00182 }
00183 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00184 /* msp430-ld may align _end incorrectly. Workaround in cpu_init. */
00185 extern int _end;                /* Not in sys/unistd.h */
00186 static char *cur_break = (char *)&_end;
00187 
00188 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00189 /* add/remove_lpm_req - for requiring a specific LPM mode. currently Contiki */
00190 /* jumps to LPM3 to save power, but DMA will not work if DCO is not clocked  */
00191 /* so some modules might need to enter their LPM requirements                */
00192 /* NOTE: currently only works with LPM1 (e.g. DCO) requirements.             */
00193 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00194 void
00195 msp430_add_lpm_req(int req)
00196 {
00197   if(req <= MSP430_REQUIRE_LPM1) {
00198     msp430_dco_required++;
00199   }
00200 }
00201 
00202 void
00203 msp430_remove_lpm_req(int req)
00204 {
00205   if(req <= MSP430_REQUIRE_LPM1) {
00206     msp430_dco_required--;
00207   }
00208 }
00209 
00210 void
00211 msp430_cpu_init(void)
00212 {
00213   dint();
00214   watchdog_init();
00215   init_ports();
00216   msp430_init_dco();
00217   eint();
00218   if((uintptr_t)cur_break & 1) { /* Workaround for msp430-ld bug! */
00219     cur_break++;
00220   }
00221   msp430_dco_required = 0;
00222 }
00223 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00224 #define asmv(arg) __asm__ __volatile__(arg)
00225 
00226 #define STACK_EXTRA 32
00227 
00228 /*
00229  * Allocate memory from the heap. Check that we don't collide with the
00230  * stack right now (some other routine might later). A watchdog might
00231  * be used to check if cur_break and the stack pointer meet during
00232  * runtime.
00233  */
00234 void *
00235 sbrk(int incr)
00236 {
00237   char *stack_pointer;
00238 
00239   asmv("mov r1, %0" : "=r" (stack_pointer));
00240   stack_pointer -= STACK_EXTRA;
00241   if(incr > (stack_pointer - cur_break))
00242     return (void *)-1;          /* ENOMEM */
00243 
00244   void *old_break = cur_break;
00245   cur_break += incr;
00246   /*
00247    * If the stack was never here then [old_break .. cur_break] should
00248    * be filled with zeros.
00249   */
00250   return old_break;
00251 }
00252 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00253 /*
00254  * Mask all interrupts that can be masked.
00255  */
00256 int
00257 splhigh_(void)
00258 {
00259   /* Clear the GIE (General Interrupt Enable) flag. */
00260   int sr;
00261   asmv("mov r2, %0" : "=r" (sr));
00262   asmv("bic %0, r2" : : "i" (GIE));
00263   return sr & GIE;              /* Ignore other sr bits. */
00264 }
00265 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00266 /*
00267  * Restore previous interrupt mask.
00268  */
00269 void
00270 splx_(int sr)
00271 {
00272   /* If GIE was set, restore it. */
00273   asmv("bis %0, r2" : : "r" (sr));
00274 }
00275 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00276 /* this code will always start the TimerB if not already started */
00277 void
00278 msp430_sync_dco(void) {
00279   uint16_t last;
00280   uint16_t diff;
00281 /*   uint32_t speed; */
00282   /* DELTA_2 assumes an ACLK of 32768 Hz */
00283 #define DELTA_2    ((MSP430_CPU_SPEED) / 32768)
00284 
00285   /* Select SMCLK clock, and capture on ACLK for TBCCR6 */
00286   TBCTL = TBSSEL1 | TBCLR;
00287   TBCCTL6 = CCIS0 + CM0 + CAP;
00288   /* start the timer */
00289   TBCTL |= MC1;
00290 
00291   // wait for next Capture
00292   TBCCTL6 &= ~CCIFG;
00293   while(!(TBCCTL6 & CCIFG));
00294   last = TBCCR6;
00295 
00296   TBCCTL6 &= ~CCIFG;
00297   // wait for next Capture - and calculate difference
00298   while(!(TBCCTL6 & CCIFG));
00299   diff = TBCCR6 - last;
00300 
00301   /* Stop timer - conserves energy according to user guide */
00302   TBCTL = 0;
00303 
00304 /*   speed = diff; */
00305 /*   speed = speed * 32768; */
00306 /*   printf("Last TAR diff:%d target: %ld ", diff, DELTA_2); */
00307 /*   printf("CPU Speed: %lu DCOCTL: %d\n", speed, DCOCTL); */
00308 
00309   /* resynchronize the DCO speed if not at target */
00310   if(DELTA_2 < diff) {        /* DCO is too fast, slow it down */
00311     DCOCTL--;
00312     if(DCOCTL == 0xFF) {              /* Did DCO role under? */
00313       BCSCTL1--;
00314     }
00315   } else if (DELTA_2 > diff) {
00316     DCOCTL++;
00317     if(DCOCTL == 0x00) {              /* Did DCO role over? */
00318       BCSCTL1++;
00319     }
00320   }
00321 }
